info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 2:39PM MDT until August 09 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN TAOS COUNTY... At 239 PM MDT, Between 0.5 and 1.0 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen over extreme Northwestern parts of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. While heavy rainfall has mostly ended, excessive runoff will remain a threat. Drainages feeding into the Aqua Piedra Creek, Rito Angosturara and other small creeks feeding into the upper Rio Pueblo will be impacted. Any debris flows can consist of torrents of water, rock, mud, ash, burned vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall and potential flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Excessive runoff over the burn scar and potentially life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tres Ritos. This includes the following recreation areas... Agua Piedra Campground, Comales Campground, Duran Canyon Campground, Sipapu Ski Area and Flechado Picnic Area. This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 45 and 57. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the extreme Northwestern Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
